TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: tangidangida a natjautsikel a qatsa a załum.
tangidangida a natjaocikel a qaca a zaljom.
S.TRANSL: There is a story of a flood long ago.

S.FORM: matjiłev a kadjunangan a izua tu nazuanga.
matjiljev a kadjonangan a izoa to nazoanga.
S.TRANSL: There were landslides everywhere.

S.FORM: nekanga nu kadjunangan, tsunuq anga sakamaya.
nekanga no kadjonangan, conoq anga sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: There was no solid ground left, only scree.

S.FORM: izua maḍusa marekaka nakidjadjas tua łagagaz.
izoa madrosa marekaka nakidjadjas toa ljagagaz.
S.TRANSL: There were two siblings who held on to some łagagaz grass.

S.FORM: qau azua maḍusa nekanga nu kadjunangan, nekanga nu tapaw; naqemauqaung anga sakamaya.
qao azoa madrosa nekanga no kadjonangan, nekanga no tapaw; naqemaoqaong anga sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: These two had no land any more and no house; they just cried.

S.FORM: palemek a izua qatjulay a ngeḍungeḍuq.
palemek a izoa qatjolay a ngedrongedroq.
S.TRANSL: It happened that there was half a worm.

S.FORM: qau nu putsaqi a puita, ita vuledan a kadjunangan.
qao no pocaqi a poita, ita voledan a kadjonangan.
S.TRANSL: Each time it defecated it formed a bit of hill land.

S.FORM: qau djemumak tua pariuk a tsevitseviq anga.
qao djemomak toa pariok a ceviceviq anga.
S.TRANSL: They also found part of a wok.

S.FORM: qau zangen niamadju.
qao zangen niamadjo.
S.TRANSL: They kept this.

S.FORM: łakua neka nu sapuy.
ljakoa neka no sapoy.
S.TRANSL: But they had no fire.

S.FORM: qai anga tiamadju.
qai anga tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: They were in a bad way.

S.FORM: "anema tja sapuy?" aya.
"anema tja sapoy?" aya.
S.TRANSL: “What are we to do for fire?” they said.

S.FORM: palemek a mangtjez a valalangan, kematsukatsu tua sapui, a kinats a pinadjekets a pitjua djałiq.
palemek a mangtjez a valalangan, kemacokaco toa sapoi, a kinac a pinadjekec a pitjoa djaljiq.
S.TRANSL: It happened that a lizard(?) came along carrying fire on a lighted torch held in its mouth.

S.FORM: qau azua maḍusa a kakeḍian patsunan.
qao azoa madrosa a kakedrian paconan.
S.TRANSL: The two children saw it.

S.FORM: "anema zua?" aya.
"anema zoa?" aya.
S.TRANSL: “What’s that?” they said.

S.FORM: ka djemałun i tjayamadju, izua sapuy.
ka djemaljon i tjayamadjo, izoa sapoy.
S.TRANSL: When it reached them, it was fire.

S.FORM: qau alapen nua maḍusa a kinatsu nua valalangan.
qao alapen noa madrosa a kinaco noa valalangan.
S.TRANSL: So the two took the torch carried by the lizard.

S.FORM: ka alapen anga nazua maḍusa a sapuy, zazua a valalangan "veng," aya tsemikel.
ka alapen anga nazoa madrosa a sapoy, zazoa a valalangan "veng," aya cemikel.
S.TRANSL: When the two took the fire, the lizard said, “Veng,” and went back again.

S.FORM: kemasi izua tuazua ini anga ka maqevutj a sapuy.
kemasi izoa toazoa ini anga ka maqevotj a sapoy.
S.TRANSL: From then on the fire did not go out.

S.FORM: zazua maḍusa meqatsa tiamadju.
zazoa madrosa meqaca tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: These two grew up.

S.FORM: qau azua qatjulay avan azua palidaw tua qipu.
qao azoa qatjolay avan azoa palidaw toa qipo.
S.TRANSL: It was the worm which excreted soil.

S.FORM: azua maḍusa patsun tua quma.
azoa madrosa pacon toa qoma.
S.TRANSL: The two looked at the fields.

S.FORM: neka nu vurasi, neka nu vasa, neka nu vaqu.
neka no vorasi, neka no vasa, neka no vaqo.
S.TRANSL: There was no sweet potato, taro or millet.

S.FORM: vaivaik anga a pikivangavang.
vaivaik anga a pikivangavang.
S.TRANSL: They went off for a stroll.

S.FORM: qau djemumak tu tsuvuq nua vurasi katua vasa katua vaqu.
qao djemomak to covoq noa vorasi katoa vasa katoa vaqo.
S.TRANSL: They found shoots of sweet potato, taro and millet;

S.FORM: qau avan anga zazua a kiudałen.
qao avan anga zazoa a kiodaljen.
S.TRANSL: and that’s how they got things to grow.

S.FORM: zazua maḍusa ka meqatsa tiamadju, "kemuda itjen?" aya kemim tua salasaladj.
zazoa madrosa ka meqaca tiamadjo, "kemoda itjen?" aya kemim toa salasaladj.
S.TRANSL: When these two grew up, they said “What are we to do?” and looked for mates.

S.FORM: neka nu patsunan a tsautsau.
neka no paconan a caocao.
S.TRANSL: They couldn’t see any people.

S.FORM: tiamadju anga mapuvaław a marekaka.
tiamadjo anga mapovaljaw a marekaka.
S.TRANSL: So those siblings married one another.

S.FORM: sangasan a puałak matseviq, mavutsa, mataił.
sangasan a poaljak maceviq, mavoca, matailj.
S.TRANSL: Their first child was disabled, blind and missing limbs and organs.

S.FORM: ka sika masan musał nanguaq anga a pagału nu puałak.
ka sika masan mosalj nangoaq anga a pagaljo no poaljak.
S.TRANSL: The second child was rather better.

S.FORM: ka sika masan tjeluł nanguaq anga; a puałak ini anga ka mavutsa, ini anga ka mataił.
ka sika masan tjelolj nangoaq anga; a poaljak ini anga ka mavoca, ini anga ka matailj.
S.TRANSL: The third was all right, not blind and not missing any limbs.

S.FORM: qau avan anga zazua kakełangan tu inika puvaław tua kaka; masa palisi, ayanga a tjautsikel.
qao avan anga zazoa kakeljangan to inika povaljaw toa kaka; masa palisi, ayanga a tjaocikel.
S.TRANSL: So that’s how they knew not to marry siblings, perhaps (because) it’s taboo, according to the story.
